text: I’m the oldest of four children.
My mother’s a stay-at-home mom.
My father was a nuclear engineer; gone all the time.
So, when you get in the house,
you’re in the house with four kids…
mmmm, makes you a little crazy.
My mom once said to us,
“Your father’s going to come home
and find you kids buried in the backyard.”
Yeah, you hear that when you’re seven,
it's time to straighten up and listen to the crazy woman.
'Cause you know, at seven,
I’m only going on hearsay that I’m the oldest.
Think about that. That’s what she said to us.
Those were… I can get a phone right now
and call my mom. She will verify this.
That’s what she said to us.
“Your father’s going to come home,
find you kids buried in the backyard.”
That’s what she said.
You understand the impact of that?
That means in her head she had already killed us.
Do you understand that? It was a done deal.
She had killed us and buried us in our own backyard.
Didn’t even try to hide us.
Like, “Here they are. Here they are right here.
I did it.
Take me to jail so I can get some peace and quiet.”
My mom’s favorite phrase, “You had all day.”
That’s my mom’s favorite phrase. Anyone else’s?
“You had all day.” What she meant by that
was no matter what you were about to do,
you had all day to do it.
Now you're just messing up her day.
“We’re about to go to the store.”
“Okay, I gotta go to the bathroom.”
“You had all day to go to the bathroom
and you wait until now?”
Here’s the beauty of that; that’s crazy logic
but, here’s the beauty of that. It helps.
I use it today. Not with my kids, just in general.
I’m driving down the street,
somebody turns left in front of me…
"You had all day to turn left and you wait until now?"
